SEARCH
Package ApplicationDefaults

Class NotifierRelay

java.lang.Object
ApplicationDefaults.NotifierRelay
public class NotifierRelay extends Object
DebugHandler exits on a parked thread. The notifier receives messages from the application for debug purposes, and unparks the DebugHandler, waking it up. The DebugHandler then calls receiveMessage() to receive the message from the buffer. WindowStateManager handled similarly. The notify method adds WindowStateEvents to the buffer, and unparks the manager which recieves it with recieveEvent().

    • notify

      public void notify(String message)
      Notify should be used by the application GUI and subclasses like WindowState.
      Parameters:
      message - Message from application used for debugging.

    • notify

      public void notify(WindowStateEvent event)
      Notify should be used by the application GUI and subclasses like WindowState.
      Parameters:
      event - Event that the QuestifyApplication should request the application to perform.

    • receiveMessage

      public String receiveMessage()
      Receive should be used by the DebugHandler.
      Returns:
      Message from application used for debugging.

    • receiveEvent

      public WindowStateEvent receiveEvent()
      Receive should be used by the WindowStateManager.
      Returns:
      Event from application used for managing WindowStates.

    • noticedTerminate

      public boolean noticedTerminate()
      Checks if we noticed a terminate event. Used by DebugHandler to safely detect when the program is terminating without relying on receiveMessage(), which could lead to unsafe injection conditions, (i.e. you want to print the message "terminate." to the DebugHandler, and end up terminating the DebugHandler instead).
      Returns:
      boolean on if the relay noticed that the manager has been notified of the app closing.
